rules.name: go-error-handling
rules.description: Rules for consistent error handling in Go code

avoid.message: Avoid inline error checking. Separate the operation from its error check for better readability and debugging.
Avoid inline error checking with discarded values. Separate the operation from its error check.
Avoid ignoring errors. Either handle the error or explicitly document why it's safe to ignore.

prefer.message: Separate error checking from the operation for better readability and debugging.

documentation.description: Go error handling should be explicit and clear. Separating operations from their error checks improves code readability, debugging, and maintainability.
